qas.question: What were common task of the corporation formed by the urban and rural districts?

answers.text: schools, traffic installations, hospitals, cultural institutions, jails

qas.question: What was the name of the corporation that looked over common task?
What has since happened from 1919 that involve the provincial diets?

answers.text: elected by the citizens of the provinces

qas.question: How many representatives serve in each provincial diet?
How many Landeshauptmann are there in total?
In what specific year in the 1880s did the Landdirektor position get renamed as Landeshauptmann?
How are the assemblies of the urban and rural district positions filled from 1875 to 1919?

context: Since <b4_0><b5_0>1875<b5_0/><b4_0/>, with the strengthening of self-rule, the urban and rural districts (Kreise) within each province (sometimes within each governorate) formed a corporation with common tasks and assets (<a0_0>schools, traffic installations, hospitals, cultural institutions, jails<a0_0/> etc.) called the <a1_0>Provinzialverband<a1_0/> (provincial association). Initially the assemblies of the urban and rural districts elected representatives for the provincial diets (Provinziallandtage), which were thus indirectly elected. As of <b3_0>1919<b3_0/> the provincial diets (or as to governorate diets, the so-called Kommunallandtage) were <b6_0>directly <a2_0>elected by the citizens<b6_0/> of the provinces<a2_0/> (or governorates, respectively). These parliaments legislated within the competences transferred to the provincial associations. The provincial diet of East Prussia elected a provincial executive body (government), the provincial committee (Provinzialausschuss), and a head of province, the Landeshauptmann ("Land Captain"; till the 1880s titled Landdirektor, land director).
